headline: Santander, Citi Among the Closest in Jobs Report Projections
summary: Ahead of January’s jobs report, Santander US and Citi were among the closest in projecting the number of new jobs, while Barclays and UBS were among those that correctly projected the unemployment rate.  Both the January report and Santander’s estimates projected a 130,000 increase to nonfarm payrolls.  Citi followed closely, projecting 135,000 new jobs.

headline: Citi maintains 'buy' on AstraZeneca with £170 target, cites sector-best pipeline
summary: Double-digit earnings outlook and strong trial momentum support top pick status AstraZeneca PLC (LSE:AZN, NASDAQ:AZN) remains a top pick at Citi following full-year results and 2026 guidance that the bank described as “reassuring”, with a reiterated target price of £170 and unchanged earnings...

headline: Chipotle CEO Says Over 60% Of Its Customers Earn Over $100,000: 'Gives Us Confidence...' (CORRECTED)
summary: Scott Boatwright said the company plans to continue raising prices, citing that 60% of its core customers earn over $100,000 annually.

headline: Lockheed Martin CEO and CFO to Speak at Citi's 2026 Global Industrial Tech and Mobility Conference
summary: Lockheed Martin (NYSE: LMT) Chairman, President and CEO Jim Taiclet and Chief Financial Officer Evan Scott will participate in a fireside chat at Citi's 2026 Global Industrial Tech and Mobility Conference on Wednesday, Feb. 18, from 2:40 to 3:20 p.m. ET.

headline: Mattel: Citi and JPM cut rating as analysts flag uncertain outlook
summary: Investing.com -- Mattel faced sharp criticism from Citi and JPMorgan after both banks downgraded the toymaker following its latest earnings release, citing weakening visibility around its core brands and a challenging investment phase ahead.

headline: Looking At The Narrative For BNP Paribas (ENXTPA:BNP) After Analyst Upgrades And Higher Targets
summary: What Changed in the BNP Paribas Price Target Model The updated fair value for BNP Paribas now sits at about €98.87, up from about €93.87, with only small tweaks to the revenue growth input at about 7.21% and profit margin assumption at about 25.18%, while the discount rate is unchanged at 12.3%. Those shifts mirror how several banks have recently revisited their views on the bank's execution and earnings power, nudging their own targets higher while keeping core risk assumptions steady. To...

headline: 3 Bank Stocks That Fall Short
summary: Banks play a critical role in the financial system, providing everything from commercial loans to wealth management and payment processing services. Furthermore, economic conditions have supported loan growth and fee income, a trend that has enabled the banking industry to return 19.1% over the past six months. At the same time, the S&P 500 was up 9.1%.
